IDBKeyRange.summary: The IDBKeyRange interface of the IndexedDB API represents a continuous interval over some data type that is used for keys. Records can be retrieved from and objects using keys or a range of keys. You can limit the range using lower and upper bounds. For example, you can iterate over all values of a key in the value range A–Z.

remarks.para: A key range can be a single value or a range with upper and lower bounds or endpoints. If the key range has both upper and lower bounds, then it is bounded; if it has no bounds, it is unbounded. A bounded key range can either be open (the endpoints are excluded) or closed (the endpoints are included). To retrieve all keys within a certain range, you can use the following code constructs:
A key is in a key range if the following conditions are true:

IDBKeyRangeIncludes.summary:
The includes() method of the
interface returns a boolean indicating whether a specified key is inside the key
range.

remarks.para:
-Using IndexedDB
-Starting transactions:
-Using transactions:
-Setting a range of keys:

IDBKeyRangeBound.summary:
The bound() static method of the
interface creates a new key range with the specified upper and lower bounds. The
bounds can be open (that is, the bounds exclude the endpoint values) or closed (that
is, the bounds include the endpoint values). By default, the bounds are closed.

IDBKeyRangeUpper.summary:
The upper read-only property of the
interface returns the upper bound of the key range.

IDBKeyRangeUpper.value: The upper bound of the key range (can be any type.)

IDBKeyRangeUpperOpen.summary:
The upperOpen read-only property of the
interface returns a boolean indicating whether the
upper-bound value is included in the key range.

remarks.para:
-Using IndexedDB
-Starting transactions:

-Setting a range of keys:
-Retrieving and making changes to your data:

-Reference example: To-do Notifications (View the example live).

IDBKeyRangeUpperOpen.value:
A boolean value:
ValueIndication
trueThe upper-bound value is not included in the key range.
falseThe upper-bound value is included in the key range.

interface returns the lower bound of the key range.

IDBKeyRangeUpperBound.summary:
The upperBound() static method of the
interface creates a new upper-bound key range. By default,
it includes the upper endpoint value and is closed.

remarks.para:

IDBKeyRangeOnly.summary:
The only() static method of the
interface creates a new key range containing a single value.

remarks.para:
-Using IndexedDB

IDBKeyRangeLowerBound.summary:
The lowerBound() static method of the
interface creates a new key range with only a lower bound.
By default, it includes the lower endpoint value and is closed.

interface returns a boolean indicating whether the
